item.title: Report X-2023091024
item.description:
Report X-2023091024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the load side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: 2 of 2 2.5-gallon bottles had a loose cap, resulting in the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a plastic pail was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the pail was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: The content had a loose cap, resulting in leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the plastic pail's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

LID OF CAN POPPED OPEN ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT, DAMAGING THE OTHER ITEM IN THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN LINED CONTAINER

item.title: Report X-2023081041
item.description:
Report X-2023081041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the heavyweight buildup area for a leaking shipment. The shipment was two metal jerrycans banded to a wooden skid. A forklift punctured one of the jerrycans causing a release of all of its contents. The spill was contained and cleaned up. The damaged jerrycan will be disposed of a hazardous material and the remaining jerrycan is being held till a new declaration can be obtained.

item.title: Report X-2023081035
item.description:
Report X-2023081035

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/15/2023 at approximately 1740, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two cans of paint. One of the boxes displayed damage due to spillage from one the cans. The damaged shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport. X-2023081036-On 8/15/2023 at approximately 1740, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two cans of paint. One of the boxes displayed damage due to spillage from one the cans. The damaged shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023080954
item.description:
Report X-2023080954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/05/2023 at approximately 1333, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing four aluminum cans. Two of the cans were reported as allegedly being over-pressurized, causing one can to accidentally discharge uncontrollably from the nozzle and the other burst, tearing the bottom of the can completely off. Due to the overseas origin and destination, this shipment has been set for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023080472
item.description:
Report X-2023080472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T00:31:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080472: On July 29th a drum was found during the AM sort that was leaking UN1197, EXTRACTS LIQUID, 3, III. It is unknown how the drum came to be punctured. The drum was placed into a steel salvage drum pending an amended shippers declaration to return it to the shipper. 2. X-2023080473: On July 29th the drum was discovered leaking during the AM sort. Approximately 1L of UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII leaked out of the drum. Damage was observed on the can, and this may have contributed to the leak. The drum was placed into a salvage drum, and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration. 3. X-2023080474: On July 29th a package was discovered leaking. It contained UN1263, PAINT, 3, II in in two metal cans. One of the cans started leaking. The package was placed into a salvage drum. It is unknown how the damage occurred to cause the leak. The shipper has been contacted to provide an amended shippers declaration and for further disposition.
